title: Augusta County: Henry H. Dedrick to Mary E. A. Dedrick, May 25, 1863
summary: Dedrick discusses his recent illness and the status of deserters who have been returned. He states rations have been increased but asks for tobacco from home.
keywords: Camp Life, Death/Casualties, Desertion/Leave, Family, Military Authority, Prison/Prisoners, Troop Movement, American Civil War
